reviewText:
I for a long time scoffed at this game. I wrote it off as nothing but a cash grab to lore people in but I now can see

Five Nights At Freddy's truley is a gripping game. It has your spooky pumpkins and demonic carrots. Aliens waiting to rip your face off and an evil puppy. Not to mention the human drama of will we set up the birthday before the security officer wakes up.

I will not spoil anything of this roller coaster horror drama game but I will tell you, it may change your views on life it's self.

10/10 custom birthday cakes

reviewText: This game reminds me of my father, he and I did something like this when I was just like Kayla, young and curious. This adventure is remarkable and I will never forget it, this will be a memory for ever. When/if I get a kid in the future, I'm going to make a birthday like this for them. Hopefully they will be as happy as Kayla. The feeling when she got so happy made me cry, such a lovely family. Without the help from Fatty Bear, this epic story would not have been anything, he's a hero and will always be a hero for me!

reviewText:
I bought the Humongous Entertainment Complete Pack during Steam Winter Sales last year when I saw it was compatible with current Operating Systems including Mac and I was absolutely thrilled. At the time this wasn't included in the pack, which made me sad because I had very fond memories of playing this game as a kid. Thinking back on my childhood, it's probably my 3rd favorite HE game, falling short only to SPY Fox in: Dry Cereal and Pajama Sam 2: Thunder and Lightning Aren't so Frightening. When I saw this game had been added to the pack and I had it because I had the pack (or maybe it had just been made Mac compatible, regardless, I saw I could download it) I was absolutely thrilled because I had just been lamenting over not having this game.

While I don't think this would be a particularly interesting game for most adults, there's massive nostalgia value for me and playing it now threw me back to when I played it as a kid. I had a ton of fun and it was like a trip back to my childhood!

I would definitely recommend it if you either A. played it as a child and have fond memories or B. have young children and want games for them. Actually if you have children and can afford it, I'd reccommend buying the entire Humongous Entertainment pack as there's hours and hours of entertainment value in there in pretty simple games originally made for kids to play!

It takes me about 45 minutes now as an adult to get through most Humongous Entertainment games I played for hours as a kid, but as a kid it took me a lot longer, I remember getting very immersed and they had a lot of replay value! I would absolutely recommend this game and virtually any other game from Humongous Entertainment along these lines for anyone with younger kids.

(They're not boring as an adult either, in my opinion, if you want to sit with your kid and help them play or play with them!)

reviewText:
Pros
There is a Bear... named Fatty
You bake a cake, but dont need to know anything
There is a bowling mini game... that gives you nothing... but it's there.... SUPER DUPER TOTES REALISM
Mouse walks around with key in mouth... Kinky?
Kid Friendly...
Amazing when drunk or in a skype call with friends.
The cake is a Chocolate Chip Cake?
BEST VOICE ACTING EVER! 10/10
You can draw on the cake!
You can play dress up in the attic and there is MULTIPLE outfits. However you cant leave with them.

Cons
No Settings menu, but you can alt+enter to window and stretch it how you like.
Can't change volume without going to your computers volume master settings.
Dog is forced to be in a box without holes in it. CALL PETA!!!!
Cocaine makes this game better!
Father takes all the credit for everyones work.
Father is not concerned about finding a cake with lit candles in his daughters room.

My experience!
This game was the best 30 minutes of my life. I was in a skype call with my buddy Warengar. While sharing my screen and sharing webcams. We had the time of our lives. This game was a gift and became a treasure. Although this game is absolute ♥♥♥♥ and should never be purchased... We played it. It is only good because it's ♥♥♥♥ and when I say good... It sucks... Have fun :D

reviewText: Fatty Bear was one of the more obscure characters from the Humongous Game catalog. He never received any sequals excluding one spin-off game made afterwards. The game focuses on a toy bear named Fatty who is a cross between Winnie the Pooh and Teddy Ruxpin voiced by Scott Burns(Bowser from the Mario Bros. games) who prepares a birthday surprise for his owner Kayla along with the help of other toys to set up decorations and a cake. The game isn't as exciting as the other Humongous Games, but it was highly playable so I won't be too hard on it. I couldn't imagine there being more games on Fatty Bear, cause he's not a cool and suave hero like Spy Fox, not a mystery solving fish like Freddi Fish, not an imaginative kid like Pajama Sam. He's just a kind hearted toy bear who resembles other toy bears you would see in other medias. Though the game is worth introducing to your kids, but just don't expect it to be an ultra classic is all.

reviewText:
Welcome to your new summer job at Fatty Bear's Pizza, where kids and parents alike come for entertainment and food as far as the eye can see! The main attraction is Fatty Bear, of course; and his two friends. They are animatronic robots, programmed to please the crowds! The robots' behavior has become somewhat unpredictable at night however, and it was much cheaper to hire you as a security guard than to find a repairman.

From your small office you must watch the security cameras carefully. You have a very limited amount of electricity that you're allowed to use per night (corporate budget cuts, you know). That means when you run out of power for the night- no more security doors and no more lights! If something isn't right- namely if Fatty Bear or his friends aren't in their proper places, you must find them on the monitors and protect yourself if needed!

Can you survive five nights at Fatty's?

10/10 #2spooky4me

reviewText: I never played this when I was younger so it was my first playthrough. It's a bit too simple for me & was lacking in plot compared to the other Humongous Games I've played. The voice of Fatty started getting on my nerves a bit and didn't fit well to the character. I'm aware I am not the target audience anymore but I like all their other games. However, this was the first game the company made so prehaps it just hasn't aged well. It was interesting to see all the details in the game eg, a mini game, personalised elements & being able to click on a bunch of backdrop that Humongous  would go on to encorporate into their later work. It's worth playing to get a sense of how far the company progress since their first release. I recommend buying this in the complete set of Humongous games, when it's on sale. Rather than as a stand alone purchase. Sorry if this angers the Fatty Bear Fandom!
